ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: more than 10 hours
8-9 hours per homework, 3 homework assignments total
6 hours
3 hours

10-15 hours during weeks when homework was due. I think Maria overestimated our abilities - some questions were very time intensive! But the assignments were appropriate and necessary in helping me learn the concepts.
10 hours a week.
5h
I spent at times 15-20 hours per week on class assignments for this class not including reading.
15hr/week
I spent at least 12 hours/week outside the classroom.
8 hours/week

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Lecture was clear and the lecture note made by Maria wasPERFECT!
632 was an excellent course. The material was very relevant to real-world applications of applied biostats in epi analysis.
Nice.
The powerpoint slides and lectures were great. I learned so much! Also, I think the homework and tests were very reflective of what we were expected to learn.

Strengths: Excellent instructor, very useful and practical approach to categorical data analysis. I learned a lot in this course.Weaknesses: A little too quick of a tour through logistic regression. The only reason I had a clue about regression in general was because I had taken Applied Linear Regression with Heping Zhang in the fall. Because this is a half-semester course, there was not sufficient time to dwell on the important theoretical concepts that drive logistic regression. I don't want a PhD level of understanding, but it would have been nice to have more time to process/really understand the material. Rather than combining this course with Survival Analysis, I would suggest combining it with Categorical Data Analysis and therefore spending an entire semester really thinking about logistic regression.
The instructions and expectations for the first two assignments were unclear. The course started out as seemingly unorganized, but improved in the second half.
It was very well organized and Maria made it very clear what she wanted us to do on the homeworks and what she wanted us to take away from the class.
Useful course!

This is the best biostats course I've taken at Yale. It was the perfect balance of some background theory with emphasis on practical applied analysis. It covers all of the necessary topics and shows how analyses are actually conducted in epi studies.
Great course, should be an entire semester

One of the best courses Ive taken so far. The material was presented logically and interesting with many examples and SAS code. The lecture notes were sufficient to successfully complete the course. The workload wasnt too heavy and enough time was given to complete homeworks.
Dr. Ciarleglio provides crystal clear material, her slides are unbelievably beautiful and clearI wish the material would have been more applied and less theroretical though..
The lecture slides and textbook were incredibly helpful and have been used as references for other classes.
good

I enjoyed this class. It is a good class that reinforces epidemiologic principles and theories and apply it to practical analysis using SAS. The lecture notes were very well organized and detailed. However, homework were unnecessarily long.
helpful but a lot of work
Excellent powerpoint slides that summarize the material well.
also a lot of time spent on the homeworkwould provide more feedback on homeworks (ansewr key?)
The course was very interesting, but some of the material seemed a bit too theoretical.

I think it is a good course, but it is too much for a half semester. It would be better if it was a full semester and includes labs (like linear regression). Maybe it should join with categorical analysis.
The course was very well organized and informative. I learned so much about qualitative and quantitative analysis in epidemiology studies.
Very good

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Same as above.

Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Dr. Ciarleglio is an excellent instructor who exceeds all expectations. She is always prepared and serves as an friendly resource for her students. She has an encyclopedic grasp on biostatistics that is truly impressive, and she is capable of tailoring her message to students without a firm statistics background.
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Very helpful.
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Dr. Ciarleglio is incredible! She is an outstanding biostatistics professor for people studying epidemiology. Best biostats class I have taken at YSPH.
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Excellent instructor. Very smart, approachable, young. Responsive to students questions and suggestions.

Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Same instructor for Applied Survival Analysis. She makes thorough and organized slides and will always immediately revise and upload updated lessons if there are typos/mistakes. She tends to teach to the projector screen instead of the class, but it does not distract from the overall course experience.
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  This was a very well organized class, my only suggestion is that she might want to try to engage the class a little more. Maybe actually run the SAS samples?
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Maria is a good instructor!

Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  I can't say enough wonderful things about Maria. She was very accessible, open to questions, and so kind, but most importantly, she knows her stuff and teaches it well. Her notes are so clear, organized, and well-written with appropriate examples. I will be using these slides for a long time.

Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Maria is wonderful! One of the best biostats instructors i've ever had. She is available to meet when needed. I will use her slides for years to come. Very clear lectures.

Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Maria is a great lecturer. She was always well organized and prepared. All notes were distributed ahead of time over the internet. Maria was very approachable, always ready to help and answer any questions about the covered material. She is very knowledgeable.

Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Increadibly smart, with excellent command of the material!My only regret is that she could not engage the class more: needs to make more eye contact with the audience so she can take clues as to when she goes too fast, maybe?very accessible, eager to help, wonderful personality!
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Very helpful when I had questions after class
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Very kind

Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Dr. Ciarleglio was a great instructor. She was always very clear, but her notes were often very long. Sometimes, notes were rushed through because of lack of time and were not gone over in great detail. However, I thought she spoke well and was very quick to answer questions raised by the students.
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  SHe is helpful
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Knowledgeable and summarizes the material well.
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  very good

Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Dr. Ciarleglio was a really good lecturer. She'll only get better. Her notes were very thorough. She was very helpful to students and was always willing to help. She did a good job of making the material understandable. It's hard to think of things to work on, but sometimes she read from the slides. Overall, a great professor.
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  The instructor is very good. She did a great jog summarizing the information in her slides.
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Very nice

Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Maria consistently works to make complex ideas easy to understand and learn. She is truly committed to her students. She cares about their experience and values their input. She is always available to help, and provide opportunities for her students.
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Excellent

narratives.question_text: If this course included instruction by a teaching assistant (TA), please evaluate the TA here. What are the strengths and weaknesses and how might their teaching be improved? (Specify name of the TA).
comments: Gregory Ryslik was a great TA and was fair and unbiased in his grading. We appreciate his hard work.
Greg. With great humor.
Didn't interact with him during this class.
Greg is an excellent TA. Clearly very smart and knows his stuff, responds quickly to questions and willing to help over email if you can't make it to his office hours.
Greg RysilkUnclear expectations on first couple homework assignments, but improved by the last couple assignments.
Greg was very helpful
Greg is responsible.
I didn't have much interaction with Greg, so I don't have much to comment on. He always graded our assignments in a timely manner, and I definitely appreciated that.
Greg - Okay. Seemed very busy didn't have a lot of time to meet with students. Okay when gave a lecture but went through calculus too quickly.
Greg Ryslik was very flexible with scheduling TA hours and helpful with homeworks. He was overall a good TA.
ok
Knowledgeable but inconsistent grading.
ok, but seemed impatient at times
The TA was very helpful and easy to talk to
The TA was good, he was helpful and available whenever we need him.
The TA did a very good job in answering questions.
Excellent

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Definitely Yes!Much helpful than expected

This course is ideal for a student looking to apply what they learned in entry level biostatistics and epidemiology courses. I highly recommend the course to anyone interested in epidemiology or applied biostatistics.
Yes.
This class is the best blend of biostatistics and epidemiology. I think it should be required (maybe even replace Biostats II).

Good course. A must-take if you are biostats or Epi and want to avoid the horrors of Categorical Data Analysis in the fall. Expect to spend a lot of time on homeworks, but they are well-chosen and reinforce the important concepts.
I would recommend this course to another student.
Useful!

A course for ALL biostatistics and epidemiology students to take - it will be the most useful biostats course that I will have taken. For CDE doctoral students, I highly recommend taking this course BEFORE Epi 3 - it will make a world of difference.
Great course! Take it. Learned a lot! Gaps in areas that I had previous are filled durin this class.

One of the best courses Ive taken so far. The material mostly covers theory but there are many SAS examples. No much background in biostatistics is required to successfully complete this course. The lecture notes were sufficient to successfully complete the course and course workload wasnt too heavy.
I would definitely recommend it, with the caveat of making sure the people pace themselves with homework

This is a great course for bringing together many of the techniques and concepts learned in other courses at YSPH. The homework is very time-consuming but helps solidify your ability to understand and execute methods of analysis.
Useful.
This was an upper level epidemiology class that reviews the basics and goes into more depth. It is very useful after taking Epi I and II. I would recommend this class to a fellow student.
helpful
time consuming
I would recommend this course, but I would tell a fellow student that it was a bit theoretical.

I would summarize it as a good course, but too much material and homework for a half semester. It can become really intense and somewhat frustrating because you won't have enough time to internalize the concepts and practice the analysis. Overall it is worthy, as there is no option for a full semester course.
Yes, I will.
